0.title: Kenyans, do not fall for this imposter Facebook page impersonating financing company M-Kopa
0.text: Kenyans looking to venture into the motorbike taxi industry can now own motorbikes by paying a deposit of between KSh8,700 and KSh15,000 (about US$66.7 and US$114.9) and a daily instalment of KSh150 (about US$1.1).
0.author: Dancan Bwire

1.title: Ignore fraudulent Social Health Authority job ad on Facebook in Kenya
1.author: Tess Wandia

2.title: Ignore TikTok videos with fake headlines to trick users into dialling suspicious USSD codes
2.text: Several TikTok videos contain sensational false claims, ranging from the alleged deaths or accidents of famous Kenyans to major political shifts in the country.
2.author: Wanjiru Kamau

6.title: No rockets were fired by Fulani herders in southeastern Nigeria, ignore social media posts

7.title: Ignore false claims that Butere high school students in Kenya died after play controversy
